TITLE: Supreme Court's overturning of Roe v. Wade will financially hurt the 'most marginalized' women, experts say
SUMMARY: The Supreme Court's decision to overturn Roe v. Wade may cause financial hardship for many women, especially those already facing economic instability.

TITLE: How much money do gas tax holidays actually save drivers? What we know, based on 3 states that put temporary suspensions in place
SUMMARY: State gas tax holidays resulted in savings that were "mostly passed on to consumers," research finds. Experts say the results of a federal plan may be limited.

TITLE: Worried about an economic downturn? Here’s what you can expect in a typical recession, according to economists
SUMMARY: As some economists raise the odds of a recession happening, here's what you need to know.

TITLE: Stashing cash finally pays off as savings interest rates rise from rock bottom in wake of Fed hikes
SUMMARY: Soaring inflation, which pushed the Fed into hiking its benchmark rate, is finally having an effect on the return savers stand to get on their money

TITLE: Inflation and rising interest rates have stressed the 60/40 investment portfolio strategy — 'but it's not dead,' says financial advisor
SUMMARY: The typical relationship between stocks and bonds has shifted this year, challenging the notion of a traditional investment portfolio.

TITLE: Women prefer values-based investing. Here's what that might mean for their wealth
SUMMARY: Most women prefer investing in a way they think will help the environmental or do social good. Their enthusiasm could help them boost long-term wealth.

TITLE: Suze Orman: Series I bonds are the one investment every person should have right now
SUMMARY: Personal finance expert Suze Orman calls nearly risk-free government series I bonds "a fabulous investment" to have amid record high inflation.

TITLE: With or without a federal gas tax holiday, here are 4 ways to save money at the pump
SUMMARY: President Biden asked Congress to suspend the federal gas tax to provide some relief for drivers. Even without a bill, there are ways to cut costs at the pump.

TITLE: Proposed changes to retirement system get approval from Senate committee, setting stage for potential passage of 'Secure 2.0' this year
SUMMARY: The EARN Act received unanimous approval from the Senate Finance Committee on Wednesday, making it more likely that "Secure 2.0" will clear Congress.

TITLE: High inflation has 58% of people nervous about their savings, survey finds. One trick may help you boost your emergency cash
SUMMARY: The percentage of people who are uncomfortable with the money they have set aside is now 58%, up from 44% two years ago, a new Bankrate.com survey finds.

TITLE: Tax return backlog is still 'crushing the IRS’ — and taxpayers — as pileup exceeds 21 million, agency watchdog reports
SUMMARY: The IRS backlog of tax returns has swelled to over 21 million, despite efforts to clear the pileup, according to a watchdog report.

TITLE: Education Department agrees to cancel $6 billion in debt for some 200,000 student loan borrowers
SUMMARY: The U.S. Department of Education has agreed to cancel the student loans of around 200,000 people who had brought a class action lawsuit.

TITLE: Suze Orman has a warning for those who want to quit in the Great Resignation
SUMMARY: The job market is hot, but inflation is high and there are fears about an impending recession. Here's what Suze Orman says you need to do.

TITLE: Consumer watchdog eyes crackdown on credit card late fees as inflation threatens to increase them
SUMMARY: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau wants to rewrite rules around credit-card late fees to save cardholders billions of dollars a year.

TITLE: Average credit card interest rates have topped 20%. Here's how to pay down that debt fast
SUMMARY: As the Federal Reserve raises interest rates, credit card annual percentage rates are set to hit new highs. Here's how to pay down your debt fast.

TITLE: Millions of students never finish college. Here's what loan forgiveness may mean for them
SUMMARY: Any announcement on student loan forgiveness by the White House could be especially meaningful for borrowers who never earned a diploma.

TITLE: Student loan forgiveness 'is not a problem that concerns the wealthy or the Ivy League,' Schumer says
SUMMARY: Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer, D-N.Y., called on the labor movement to join him in his fight to get President Joe Biden to forgive $50,000 per borrower.

TITLE: IRS is making progress on tax return backlog, but millions remain unprocessed — including 11 million individual returns
SUMMARY: The IRS is making progress on its backlog of unprocessed tax returns, but millions remain, according to the agency.

TITLE: As 529 plan balances shrink, parents may want to consider this investment to build college savings
SUMMARY: The average 529 plan balance has shrunk in recent month. Some financial advisors say I bonds may be worth considering as an alternative.

TITLE: 100 million adults have health-care debt — and 12% of them owe $10,000 or more
SUMMARY: A new study shows that health-care debt — both medical and dental — is more widespread than previously thought.

TITLE: How likely are stimulus checks to be used in the next recession? Economists weigh in
SUMMARY: Stimulus checks were used at a larger scale in the pandemic-era recession than ever before. Why Americans could see the payments again in the next downturn.

TITLE: This is what women must do to overcome the retirement savings shortfall, says a financial pro
SUMMARY: A financial pro shares her top tips to to shore up a long-term plan and close the retirement savings gap, once and for all.

TITLE: As Biden weighs a federal gas tax holiday, here's what that could mean for prices at the pump
SUMMARY: With gas prices at historic highs, the Biden administration and Democratic lawmakers are considering giving drivers a break on federal gas taxes.

TITLE: Beyonce's 'Break My Soul' is a sign the Great Resignation 'has seeped into the zeitgeist,' says labor economist
SUMMARY: Beyonce released a new single, "Break My Soul," on Monday. The song taps into the worker malaise that led a record number of Americans to quit their jobs.

TITLE: Amazon Prime Day is coming up. Focus will be on consumer staples to counter surging inflation, experts say
SUMMARY: Amazon has moved its two-day shopping event to July this year. Here's how to make the most of the big sale.

TITLE: Past financial crises have made millennials 'more cautious, more proactive' in how they manage money, survey finds
SUMMARY: More than half of millennials surveyed feel confident in their ability to protect their finances if there is a recession, finds Nationwide Retirement Institute.

TITLE: Tax pros ‘very skeptical’ about expanded IRS voice bots for payments plans
SUMMARY: The IRS has expanded artificial intelligence-driven voice bots to tackle payment plans, according to the agency. But tax professionals remain skeptical.

TITLE: It's a pension quandary: Rising interest rates make it trickier to choose between a lump sum or an annuity
SUMMARY: If you're nearing retirement and are leaning toward taking your pension as an upfront payout, here's how higher interest rates will impact that amount.

TITLE: 80% of economists see 'stagflation' as a long-term risk. What it is and how to prepare for it
SUMMARY: Stagflation refers to a combination of high inflation and high unemployment. Here's why experts are worried the economy may be susceptible to those conditions.

TITLE: Child care is getting more expensive. Here’s how much parents are paying and ways they're coping with rising prices
SUMMARY: Parents, already dealing with rising inflation, are also facing increasing child care costs.
